result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • William D Pierotti was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs Paid in Full - Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Fine Paid in Full - Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.

records.addlTxt: Case Called at 2:02 PM: Defendant William D Pierotti in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties admit receipt of PSI Report - no factual corrections offered by counsel.  Court has also reviewed filings received by Defendant - counsel admit receipt of same.  Court also reviews correspondence provided by the State, Dated 12/16/2015 from Defendant.  Victim Rights in compliance.  Argument by ADA - argues for deviation from DOC recommendation.  Argument by SPD.  Statement by Defendant:  Yes.  The Court:  50 mos term of imprisonment - bifurcated as 14 mos IC/36 mos  ES (104 days of TS credit, 69 and 35 days inpatient) Conditions of ES:    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru as recommended; $2500 fine inclusive of costs, DNA Sample to be provided; 36 mos DL Rev/IID, Eligible for SAP/Ineligible for CIP (aged out).  Appeal Rights Given.  $42.50 blood draw fee ordered.
with Attachments, Dated 12/29/2015 - Copies were provided to the DA and SPD Szilagyi

Case called @ 2:20 p.m. Defendant William D Pierotti in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. ADA Anderson requesting a PSI which the court orders. The court revokes bond and the defendant is remanded to the custody of the Waushara County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
from LaCrosse Area Veterans Court - DE is not eligible for the LAVC Program

Case called @ 1:32 p.m.  Defendant William D Pierotti in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting an adjourned plea/sentencing. DA Blader is requesting that a PSI be prepared when the plea is entered.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:58 p.m. Defendant William D Pierotti in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi - matter was to proceed to plea/sentencing today but the defendant has been found eligible for a veterans treatment court and DE would like to explore the treatment court further. DA Blader - no objection to an adjournment to look further into the treatment court option as part of the resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Treatment programs being investigated currently.  It is believed matter will be resolved.  STC Scheduled  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:10 am.

2:42 pm case called. Defendant William D Pierotti in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions the defendant regarding waiver and accepts waiver of the right to the preliminary hearing. Court has read the criminal complaint, has found probable cause and binds the defendant over. Information filed by DA Blader. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading-entry of Not Guilty plea.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 09:10 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant William D Pierotti in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues as to bond for $3000 cash w/conditions.  SPD argues for much lower cash or signature bond - Def would not be considered a flight risk.  Court orders a $2500 Cash Bond w/conditions. Court questions SPD as to a possible TAD referral for Def and any dealings with VA Services.   IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court finds probable cause exists as to allegations in Ct No 1.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
